channel.title: Making my own script. simple question
channel.description:
Ok, so im making my own script, and in a loop, i have the variable T. at the end of each cycle i want to increment T by one. what should the line format be? i know i cant do T+=1; (or can i?) and scar doesnt like (T=T+1); also, if i begin a new loop, should the line resetting T look like: T=0; thanks for the help.
Edit: Nevermind. figured it out. made a variable S, got it to = 1. then did T:=T+S

item.title: Making my own script. simple question
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

[quote=“reece844, post:4, topic:109118”]Divide= T := T / 1
Multiply= T := T * 1[/quote]
I was quessing he knew the basics of mulitplying, dividing, and stuff like that lol.

And if he didn’t know, - means subtract

But := changes a value into whatever you want, thats mainly what you wanted to know.

Read full topic
item.source: Making my own script. simple question

item.title: Making my own script. simple question
item.dc:creator: @reece844 reece844
item.description:
@reece844 wrote:

Divide= T := T / 1
Multiply= T := T * 1

Read full topic
item.source: Making my own script. simple question

item.title: Making my own script. simple question
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Yeah, what reece844 posted was a good example, but he didn’t have an until in the main loop.

Just make it a var and do T := T + 1; so the value of t = its value + 1 (or whatever you add/muliply/divide).

Read full topic
item.source: Making my own script. simple question

item.title: Making my own script. simple question
item.dc:creator: @reece844 reece844
item.description:
@reece844 wrote:

Ill give u an example,

I am not sure if the script works or not because i wrote it without using scar but it
is just an example

program Help;
{.include SRL/SRL.Scar}

var
 T :Integer;

const
 color=3788387;

procedure help;
begin
  FindMSColorTol(x,y,Color,3)
 mmouse(x,y,3,3)
T:=T+1; //or you could do T:=T+1
end;


begin
SetupSRL;
repeat
help;
writeln('Found'+ inttostr(T))
end.

Read full topic
item.source: Making my own script. simple question

item.title: Making my own script. simple question

item.description:
@tissuess wrote:

Ok, so im making my own script, and in a loop, i have the variable T. at the end of each cycle i want to increment T by one. what should the line format be?
i know i cant do T+=1; (or can i?)
and scar doesnt like (T=T+1);
also, if i begin a new loop, should the line resetting T look like:
T=0;
thanks for the help.

Edit: Nevermind. figured it out. made a variable S, got it to = 1. then did T:=T+S
